intro: Tricalysia obanensis subsp. kwangoensis, commonly known as the Kwango African rose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that have a velvety texture. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
